summary: people criticize brie larson for being snarky, confident, and outspoken and claim “she’s arrogant” or “she’s incapable, a bad...
body: people criticize brie larson for being snarky, confident, and outspoken and claim “she’s arrogant” or “she’s incapable, a bad actress, etc.” the same qualities y’all criticize her for are the same ones you LOVE about iron man smh

blog.name: thefancywerewolf
blog.title: Conspiracies Everywhere
blog.description:
Multi fandom blog

Currently still constantly missing gravity falls

Everything is on hiatus rip

He/him 18

summary:
I just ... 
This Brie Larson bullshit train has been beyond annoying for so long because she’s being criticized for existing and...
body:
I just …

This Brie Larson bullshit train has been beyond annoying for so long because she’s being criticized for existing and if my marvel YouTube feed could stop being hour long rants about angry men telling me captain marvel/ Brie Larson are ruining a 20 something running connected movie tv show universe just because a woman had the lead that would be lovely . But I can’t even begin to get into that right now because what the hell is happening here .

Like this is such bullshit . This is a children’s book . Not a comic book . Not a movie . Not anything geared at an adult audience. We’re talking a children’s book for children and grown men probably 20-40 or so are mad that it exists . Because for some reason they feel girls are gonna know it’s ok to be a girl and girls can be superheroes too and we don’t need to “ overdo it “ but also want to apply that to every female role model that could possibly exist so no actually I think we do need to .

You wanna say there’s great female role models in movies / there’s plenty/ too many / whatever bullshit people want to say but name one that wasn’t just immediately shot down for existing .

Rey exists in Star Wars and for “ unrelated reasons” or because “ we get the point let’s get back to a male protagonist “ the new Star Wars movies get a ton of shit all the time

Captain marvel comes out and people want to say oh sure it’s ok to like girl characters but do we have to make a whole “ thing “ out of it ? Why can’t it be considered a thing just to make a movie . You don’t see a male main character and call it a thing or a primarily white cast and call it a thing or a movie without lgbt representation and call it a thing . But the second a movie like love Simon or black panther or captain marvel comes out somehow it’s inherently different than those other movies ? Somehow it’s a “ thing “ now .

How any of these people can expect little girls to look up to someone who’s like them and a real hero when the whole world says nothing but bad things about that hero for nothing other than her gender is so beyond stupid that I just can’t understand . And if your standard for “ getting the point “ is having 2 or 3 female led movies then how about you let us “ get the point “ about male led movies and you stop making those because of it . Your logic doesn’t make sense either way .

This is probably a long post already but whatever . This is just so beyond frustrating . I really don’t know what else to say about it I’m just fed up with people who get the entire world to tell them they’re great and the second someone says “ girls are great “ they feel that pointless need to chime in “ but can’t I be great too ? “

You can only be great if you can be accepting , no honestly that’s not even the right word , you shouldn’t have to accept that maybe women and men and everyone of every gender no matter what they identify as should be equal it should just be common knowledge . So you can only be great if you have the slightest shred of common sense .

But I can’t even begin to get into that right now because what the hell is happening here .

Like this is such bullshit . This is a children’s book . Not a comic book . Not a movie . Not anything geared at an adult audience. We’re talking a children’s book for children and grown men probably 20-40 or so are mad that it exists . Because for some reason they feel girls are gonna know it’s ok to be a girl and girls can be superheroes too and we don’t need to “ overdo it “ but also want to apply that to every female role model that could possibly exist so no actually I think we do need to .

You wanna say there’s great female role models in movies / there’s plenty/ too many / whatever bullshit people want to say but name one that wasn’t just immediately shot down for existing .

Rey exists in Star Wars and for “ unrelated reasons” or because “ we get the point let’s get back to a male protagonist “ the new Star Wars movies get a ton of shit all the time

Captain marvel comes out and people want to say oh sure it’s ok to like girl characters but do we have to make a whole “ thing “ out of it ? Why can’t it be considered a thing just to make a movie . You don’t see a male main character and call it a thing or a primarily white cast and call it a thing or a movie without lgbt representation and call it a thing . But the second a movie like love Simon or black panther or captain marvel comes out somehow it’s inherently different than those other movies ? Somehow it’s a “ thing “ now .

How any of these people can expect little girls to look up to someone who’s like them and a real hero when the whole world says nothing but bad things about that hero for nothing other than her gender is so beyond stupid that I just can’t understand . And if your standard for “ getting the point “ is having 2 or 3 female led movies then how about you let us “ get the point “ about male led movies and you stop making those because of it . Your logic doesn’t make sense either way .

This is probably a long post already but whatever . This is just so beyond frustrating . I really don’t know what else to say about it I’m just fed up with people who get the entire world to tell them they’re great and the second someone says “ girls are great “ they feel that pointless need to chime in “ but can’t I be great too ? “

You can only be great if you can be accepting , no honestly that’s not even the right word , you shouldn’t have to accept that maybe women and men and everyone of every gender no matter what they identify as should be equal it should just be common knowledge . So you can only be great if you have the slightest shred of common sense .

blog.name: that-is-americas-ass-you-know-it
blog.title: i too would start a civil war for bucky barnes
blog.description:
Rumi, 20. Multifandom.

My main account is @ghosteveryonecansee. Writeblr: @sinfullystanning. Proud member of the Sebastian Stan Lust Squad

summary: Dear ppl that hate on Captain Marvel
body:
Dear ppl that hate on Captain Marvel

Lemme just say that I’d seen a few Marvel movies before Captain Marvel and I was like yeah I guess they’re okay but never ever thought I’d actually get into the franchise. Then I saw Captain Marvel and my first thought at the end was “Shit, now I need to watch all of them…” so if that doesn’t tell you something, idk man

summary: carol danvers x reader, carol says “where have you been? i’ve been waiting for hours...who’s blood is this?” to reader, reader...
question: carol danvers x reader, carol says “where have you been? i’ve been waiting for hours...who’s blood is this?” to reader, reader falls into her arms shaking
answer:
Masterlist

A knock sounded on Carol’s door, startling her from her position on the couch.

Who’s that? It’s late.

She cautiously made her way to the door, turning the knob and opening it to find you. Dirt was scattered across your face, which wore a horrified expression upon it. Tears rolled down your cheeks and splashed on your hands. They were drenched in blood.

“[Y/N]? Where have you been? I’ve been waiting for hours,” Carol exclaimed. She reached out for your hand to lead you into her apartment, but froze when she saw the blood covering your hands.”Whose blood is this?”

Your knees gave out, but before you fell, Carol caught you in her arms, holding you in a tight embrace. You burst out into sobs, burying your head into the crook of her neck.

“Baby,” she soothed, rubbing your back. “What happened?”

“I-I didn’t mean to hurt him. He just came at me, and I-I was so scared-” your sobs cut you off.

Carol’s once soft expression grew tense.

“Someone attacked you?”

When you nodded into her neck, Carol gritted her teeth. She felt the energy coursing through her, all the way to her glowing fists.

“He was drunk. He tried to grab me. I used the knife you gave me and slashed him a-and then I ran away.”

Carol’s fists cooled once she heard your quiet, frightened voice. She could kill the guy later, right now she had to be here and take care of you.

“It’s okay, baby. You’re safe. I’m right here. I won’t let anyone hurt you,” she told you, pressing a kiss to your forehead.

You slowly pulled away from the embrace, wiping your eyes and sniffling. Carol caressed your cheek before helping you up from the floor.

“Come on, let’s go to bed,” Carol said, gently taking your hand. She tried to lead you to the bedroom when you pulled her back towards you.

“Thank you,” you whispered, your hand still intertwined with hers. “I love you.”

“Love you too, gorgeous,” Carol replied, drawing you into a quick, but passionate kiss.

After you both pulled away, Carol suddenly put her hands under your thighs and lifted you up so that she was carrying you over her shoulder.

“Carol!” You shrieked before breaking out into a fit of giggles. “Put me down!”

“No can do, babe,” She responded with a glorious smile before carrying you all the way to the bedroom, where you fell asleep secure in her arms.

Tag List:

@peter-pan-hoe    @thegodofyourdreams

@iamthepenguinwhosearseisonfire    @ghostmirrortown

@lostnliterature   @lovesweetpeaa    @doowneey  @lemirabitur   

@smexylemony    @vegetarianpineapple   @king-of-the-arthurs

@peterlikescats    @oncemorewithfeelingg

@ultrunning      @saturn-aka-six

blog.name: dreamerforever-5
blog.title: Azriel’s Mate
blog.description: I absolutely love Azriel so I usually rant about him/ Occasionally I find something new or old and I won't shut up about it for awhile/ profile picture by @niru723

body:
End of credits credit scene

Just a few days ago I went to Captain Marvel with a friend. We watched it, it was awesome, and just like everybody else (except two very dumb people) we stayed for the end of credits scene. She wanted to leave after that, but I stopped her. Never leave a Marvel film unless the screen is absolutely black and even then be cautious. She was one of those people, as I’m sure there are more, who once again underestimated Marvel and their capability to have an end of credits credit scene.

tags: the people thirst and I try to give
summary: hc where carol admits she loves you while she's totally railing you (please and thanks!)
question: hc where carol admits she loves you while she's totally railing you (please and thanks!)
answer:
take this as I try to go through my monday lmao
  • whenever people ask about the first time Carol said “I love you”, both of you tell the same story, but it’s not the real one
  • the fake one you recite goes like this: she took you out for a night flight, bringing you to the top of an abandoned penthouse for a picnic when there was a meteor shower, your faces lit up by the starry night, and right at the peak of the shower, it slipped out, a goofy grin lost behind more kisses
  • but neither of you can forget the real story
  • Carol had pinned you and was fucking you into the bed with a strap - and you swore the frame was about to break, her hands wrapped around your neck as she towered over you with a wide smirk, keeping the same hard pace
  • “you were amazing tonight, baby, I love you, gods I love you so much” after you cum, she pulls out of you and pulls you into an embrace, light kisses showering your face
  • that’s when you both stop and realize that she dropped the big “l word”
  • “did you just”
  • “I think I did?”
  • “carol, love…you did not just make the first time you said ‘I love you’ to me while you were fucking me senseless,” you couldn’t help but laugh as her jaw dropped and she rolled over in embarrassment groaning and huffing, “come back here young lady! we need to figure out how to break the news to my parents!”
